explanation: The use of the assignment expression (walrus operator) inside the if line can be problematic in some environments or Python versions. I replaced the single-line assignment-expression with a separate assignment followed by a simple if check, keeping the logic identical but avoiding the walrus operator.
fixed_code:
N, P, Q = map(int, input().split())
D = list(map(int, input().split()))

res = P

for d in D:
    p = P - Q + d
    if p < res:
        res = p

print(res)
